meanings.definition: To lose all courage or hope.
meanings.sent1: After failing the test, he began to despond and felt like giving up.
meanings.sent2: She desponded when her dreams seemed out of reach.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sad face made him despond even more.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to despond over the entire town.
meanings.sent5: His desponding attitude affected those around him.

meanings.definition: A state of feeling hopeless or discouraged.
meanings.sent1: Her despond was evident in her downcast eyes.
meanings.sent2: The despond in the room was palpable after the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to play added to the despond of the party.
meanings.sent4: The despond of the situation weighed heavily on everyone's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The despond of the students was reflected in their slumped posture.
